translation.en: I wanted nothing more than my mother's happiness.
For what kind of man would I be if I did not help my mother?
translation.ko: 엄마를 돕지 않으면 난 사내도 아니지

translation.en: If I did not save her?
Have you figured it out yet, fatso?
How many years since we took over the ranch
from the Old Gent and Old Lady?
You ever try the house bath, Phil?
[Phil] Early up tomorrow, brother. Big old drive.
[Phil] There's a dead cow. Keep our cattle away.
translation.ko: 소가 죽어 있어 가까이 못 가게 해

translation.en: What's "it"? All right, fatso, I'll tell you what "it" is.
translation.ko: 뭔지 모르시겠다? 뚱보, 그럼 내가 알려주지

translation.en: Twenty-five years since our first run together.
Know what we should do? What's that?
Go camping again in the mountains and shoot ourselves some fresh elk liver.
translation.ko: 산에서 팔팔한 엘크를 잡아 간을 따는 거야

translation.en: Cook it right there on the coals like Bronco Henry taught us.
translation.ko: 브롱코 헨리한테 배운 대로 그 자리에서 석탄불에 굽는 거지

translation.en: You act like it pains you to hitch two words together.
translation.ko: 근데 왜 입 꾹 다물고 있어?

translation.en: Do you what they'd prefer to eat?
They like the fried chicken dinner.
I'm going to need your room.
-[boy] Do you like the mansion? -[woman] Too much to clean.
You wouldn't have to clean it. There would be cleaners.
translation.ko: 엄마가 할 필요 없어 청소부 쓰면 되지

translation.en: -I need three chickens. Can you do them? -All right.
[sighs] You're gonna have to move your stuff to the shed.
I'll make a bed for you on the floor.
Well, we can't wait forever. The cattle are in the yards, so drink up.
translation.ko: 마냥 기다릴 순 없어 소는 데려다 놨으니 마시자고

translation.en: I couldn't make the boys hold back forever.
Checked the power, and it's held up. Not coming till morning.
Oh, no, thanks. Phil, they're ready for us next door at the Red Mill.
translation.ko: 됐어, 레드 밀에서 저녁 먹을 거잖아

translation.en: Twenty-five years ago, where were you, Georgie Boy?
A chubby know-nothing too dumb to get through college.
translation.ko: 대학 갈 머리도 안 되는 살찐 멍청이였어

translation.en: One person in particular taught you and me ranching so we damn well succeeded.
translation.ko: 그중 한 사람이 가르쳐 준 목장 일 덕분에 우린 성공했어

translation.en: So, to us brothers, Romulus and Remus, and the wolf who raised us.
translation.ko: 우리 로물루스, 레무스 형제와 우릴 길러준 늑대를 위하여

translation.en: Rose? Rose, play piano for us please. [Rose] I can't!
translation.ko: - 로즈? 피아노 좀 쳐줘 - 못 해!

translation.en: -Is everything all right? -[George] Yes, ma'am. Fine.
[woman 2] "I've never seen a woman behind the wheel of a car."
translation.ko: 자기는 운전하는 여자를 처음 봤다는 거야

translation.en: [woman 2] I said, "Have you never seen a lady drive a car before?"
He thought the dog was driving.
I wonder what little lady made these.
So I made them to look like the ones in our garden.
They're just as real as possible.
All right. Now, gentlemen, look. See, that's what you do with the cloth.
translation.ko: 이보게들, 행주는 저렇게 두르고 다니는 거야

translation.en: -It's really just for wine drips. -[Phil] Ooh, you got that, boys?
-Did Bronco ever eat here? -No, he did not.
Uh, back then we had herring at the saloon and a whole lot of alcohol.
translation.ko: 그땐 술집에서 청어 먹으며 코가 비뚤어지게 마셨지

translation.en: I remember this one time, Bronco made this wager that he could jump any horse
translation.ko: 한번은 브롱코가 자기는 어떤 말을 줘도

translation.en: over the tables and chairs of the saloon piled up in the street.
translation.ko: 거리에 쌓인 탁자며 의자를 뛰어넘을 수 있다는 거야

translation.en: Well, we chose him a nag all right.
walked the horse up to the tables and chairs,
talking to him all the while,
stroking his big, ugly head while the horse sniffed.
translation.ko: 계속 말을 걸었지 말은 콧김을 뿜었어

translation.en: And then he swung on and rode him back and… [exhales]
But to get a nag to jump… ain't heard of.
translation.ko: 하지만 폐마로 어떻게… 그런 얘기는 들어본 적 없어요

translation.en: [hesitates] What… I don't know what you're talking about.
Do you mind quietening? We're eating.
translation.ko: 좀 조용히 합시다 이쪽은 식사 중인데

translation.en: Shut that down, or I will!
[George] Go on over. I'll settle up.
Shall I settle up now, Mrs. Gordon, or…
send the bill, and I'll post a check.
[cowhand] Come over here. I love you.
What you said about her boy tonight, Phil…
translation.ko: 형이 아까 그 애에 관해 한 얘기

translation.en: She had her ear to the door?
I said her boy needed to snap out of it and get human.
Is that how Bronco Henry learned it?
I never saw him out on a lunge, that's a fact.
[cowhand 4] What is it you see up there, Phil?
Has anyone else seen what you've seen, Phil?
Come on, Phil. What is it?
Not if you can't see it, there ain't.
[hesitates] I really just came to see you.
I wish they wouldn't do that.
I'd say they have more in them than wine. Sounds like booze.
translation.ko: 포도주보다 더 독한 술을 마시고 있나 봐요

translation.en: They're early. I should have never put the pianola in there.
translation.ko: 낮부터 술이네요 괜히 자동 피아노를 놨어요

translation.en: I see… I see the Herndon doctor and the undertaker, Mr. Weltz.
translation.ko: 헌던 마을 의사랑 장의사 웰츠 씨네요

translation.en: Oh, goodness. [sighs] I wish Peter were here. [chuckles]
He should be serving the salad, and I need to fry the chicken.
translation.ko: 애는 샐러드 서빙하고 저는 닭 튀기고요

translation.en: Sometimes if you get food on the table…
I'm gonna run and get Peter.
-Uh, looks like I'm the new waiter. -[piano stops playing]
Run into any snow down below?
Well, I guess I'll roll me a smoke since I'm woke up.
Beech. That's where I aimed for.
Whatcha doin' down there, Georgie Boy?
I was speaking to Mrs. Gordon.
Give her half a chance, and she'll be after some dollar for Miss Nancy's college fee.
translation.ko: 그 곱상한 아들 대학 보내려고 너한테 관심 보이는 거야

translation.en: Remember how the Old Lady brought those girls out to the ranch
translation.ko: 우리가 사춘기 되자마자 어머니가 여자들을 목장에 데려온 거 기억나?

translation.en: as soon as we could get hard-ons?
translation.ko: 어머니가 여자들을 목장에 데려온 거 기억나?

translation.en: Wasn't it her that wrote you,
"I always will remember the western moon"?
Well, guess you coulda taken her out
without first putting a sack over her head.
[Phil] It's a piece of ass you're after, fatso,
I'm damn sure you can get it without a license.
[cowhand] What do you do with these?
Do you cut 'em up or something?
A little desk for your big desk.
-[sighs] -Did you write to the Old Lady?
Yeah, I dropped 'em both a line.
Did you say something about Rose?
Well, you know as well as I do what the Old Lady would feel
if she thought you were getting mixed up with her.
The Old Lady would feel as one Mrs. Burbank would feel
translation.ko: 버뱅크 부인으로서 또 다른 버뱅크 부인에게 느끼는

translation.en: She got rid of her property in Beech.
Stand steady, you little bitch, huh?
Look at me, you little bitch! Huh? [grunts] Yeah?
[woman] My school boarders eat dinner at 6:00 p.m. sharp.
translation.ko: 우리 기숙사는 6시 딱 되면 저녁 먹어요

translation.en: No dish-washing duty if he has homework.
[Rose] Maybe you'd like to come to the ranch sometimes?
[Peter] May I keep some of these rose petals?
[George] I've been thinking we should have some sort of dinner party
translation.ko: 저녁 식사 자리를 만들어서 우리 부모님하고 만나보면 어떨까?

translation.en: to introduce you to my parents.
And perhaps we could invite the governor and his wife too.
I saw them in Herndon today, and, uh,
I… I kind of already mentioned it to them.
Uh, maybe you'd be kind enough to play something on our old piano.
translation.ko: 낡은 피아노가 있는데 당신이 연주해 줄래?

translation.en: But, George, I'm not very good.
-I only played for the moving pictures. -[chuckles]
You are plenty fine enough for us.
The Old Lady can't play a note, so… [chuckles]
This looks like a good spot.
One, two, three. And to the side.
-To the side again. One, two… -Sorry, I… I really can't.
translation.ko: - 다시 옆으로, 하나, 둘… - 미안, 못 하겠어

translation.en: One, two, three. To the side.
I told you I'd teach you. [chuckles]
I wanted to say how nice it is
[George] Go on up and get out of the cold.
-I'll go down and shake it up. -I've been hanging around for you all day.
translation.ko: 내려가서 건드려 볼게 온종일 너만 기다렸어

translation.en: There's a deed the Old Gent wants sent to him.
Well, I figure that can go till morning.
we had such a nice trip--
This is the bathroom. Just make yourself at home.
Now, you just make yourself comfortable.
Now, I'm going to bring you a surprise.
Well, then it won't be a surprise.
[housekeeper] When the rains come, the cellar gets flooded.
So, the rats all drown. They float to the surface.
I have to get the young lads in to scoop 'em all up with a…
[cowhand 1] We got it. [George] Head to the right.
-[George] Turn it around that way. -[young housekeeper] Please, I'll take it.
-What is it? -[George] Head to the front door.
-[George] You got it? -[cowhand 2] Yeah, I got it.
-[cowhand 3 grunting] Whoa, hold it. -It's a Mason & Hamlin baby grand.
translation.ko: - 잠깐! - 메이슨 앤드 햄린사 베이비 그랜드 피아노야

translation.en: Oh no, it's… it's too good for me. I'm…
I'm just very average. I… I only know tunes.
translation.ko: 그렇게 잘 치지도 못하고 몇 곡만 아는데

translation.en: We don't want a concert. We just wanna hear you play, Rose.
translation.ko: 콘서트가 아니라 당신 연주가 듣고 싶어

translation.en: -I should like to look on the governor… -[George] Easy.
[housekeeper] …as he drives up and gets out of his vehicle.
-[cowhand 4] One step at a time, ready? -[cowhand 5] Two, three, four.
translation.ko: - 한 번에 하나씩, 알았지? - 둘, 셋, 넷

translation.en: -[cowhand] You make a rope with these? -[Phil] These strips? Yeah.
You boys find something needs doing.
I just came over to speak about something.
Come on, partner. Open your talker. What is it?
His Nibs will be here for dinner and the Old Gent and the Old Lady.
translation.ko: 부모님과의 저녁 식사에 높으신 분도 오실 거야

translation.en: Well, sir, ain't we going into society.
No, I… I like to hear Rose play.
Well, old-timer, what is it? What's in the noodle?
-Well, it's about His Nibs, the governor. -[Phil] All right.
Well, it's not so much about His Nibs
but His Nibs' wife, actually, uh…
I was thinking His Nibs probably wouldn't mind so much,
translation.ko: 주지사님은 신경 안 쓰실 것 같은데

translation.en: Well, it's sort of a hard thing… [exhales sharply]
She might mind if you come to the table without a washup.
translation.ko: 형이 안 씻고 있으면 신경 쓰실 것 같아

translation.en: We may as well try and warm this place.
Use your hand. Use your hand like so.
You keep warm. I can bring them in.
translation.ko: 밖에 추우니까 집에 있어 내가 마중 나갈게

translation.en: [woman chuckling] Oh, how sweet. They have their own umbrella.
-[George] Orange blossoms. -It's an island of civilization here.
translation.ko: - 오렌지 블로섬이에요 - 외딴 데 있어도 세련됐네요

translation.en: I was, uh, telling Georgie about your brother.
Phi Beta Kappa at Yale, wasn't it?
So, uh… he swears at the cattle in Greek or Latin?
Uh, Rose plays the piano very well.
I'll just go have a look-see out the back for Phil.
Oh, good. I want to meet this brother.
[woman] I suppose there was some sort of an injury. [Old Lady laughing] Oh, Edward, Georgina.
translation.ko: - 어디 다친 것 같아 - 에드워드, 조지나

translation.en: Ah! Here are two people we can't fool.
Oh no, you cannot. We know everything. We're walking encyclopedias.
translation.ko: 그럼요, 모르는 게 없죠 난 걸어 다니는 사전이에요

translation.en: At least I am. I have nothing to do but read.
translation.ko: 난 걸어 다니는 사전이에요 할 일 없으니 책만 읽거든요

translation.en: [Old Gent] She's been reading "The Curse of Tutankhamun" in The Digest.
So, uh, you believe in the curse?
Oh, no, no, I'm not drinking George's concoction.
translation.ko: 안 줘도 돼 조지 칵테일은 안 마실래

translation.en: Yes, I do. But did you know that Tutankhamun was just a boy?
Everyone's here. And we're just about to eat.
Yes, we're counting on your conversation.
I shouldn't have said what I said to you about--
You two can keep your apologies to yourself. I'm not coming.
translation.ko: 맘에도 없는 소리 마, 안 가

translation.en: The Old Lady wants to see you too. She's come a long way.
translation.ko: 어머니도 보고 싶어 하셔 멀리서 오셨다고

translation.en: You can tell them the truth.
That I stink and I like it.
[Old Lady] Nothing could have happened to Phil, could it?
[George] No, he'll be fine. Something just must've come up.
are you going to play for us?
[Old Lady] Yes, George told me you play very well.
-Oh no, I'm terribly out of practice. -[Edward] Yes, we'd love that.
translation.ko: - 아뇨, 안 친 지 오래예요 - 한번 들려줘요

translation.en: Come now, you've been playing a lot. You know you have.
I don't know what to play.
-What one? -Why, the… the one about the Gypsy.
translation.ko: - 무슨 곡? - 왜, 집시에 관한 거 있잖아

translation.en: I… I can't seem to remember that one.
I… I played in a cinema pit for hours and hours.
translation.ko: 영화관에선 몇 시간을 친 적도 있는데

translation.en: Well, she got you halter trained, right, George? That's the main thing.
translation.ko: 아내한테 꽉 잡혀 사는군요 그렇게 사는 거죠

translation.en: No, it was a lovely, lovely evening. Thank you.
So, you weren't eaten by a cougar.
I am sorry to have missed your conversation.
You're gonna want to keep your distance. I'm just off the horse.
translation.ko: 너무 다가오진 마세요 방금 말에서 내렸거든요

translation.en: You've been listening to the pinano and dancing, I guess.
translation.ko: 피아노 연주 들으며 춤추고 계셨던 것 같은데

translation.en: You sure did practice a terrible lot.
See, you wouldn't think there was much difference
between a cinema pit and a dinner party.
[Old Lady] Where have you been, Phil?
I could hardly eat worrying about you.
I didn't get washed up, so I didn't come.
Oh, he's a ranchman, isn't that right? That's honest dirt.

translation.ko: - 잘 먹고 가요 - 와 주셔서 감사해요

translation.en: [George] I'll just run and grab you a blanket for the ride.
[Rose] I wondered if you didn't think about
leaving your medical books here for the summer.
I thought about it, but… but you understand they were Dad's.
He calls me Doctor, and I call him Professor,
translation.ko: 걘 날 의사라고 하고 난 걜 교수라고 해

translation.en: Why don't you invite your friend to the ranch?
I don't want him to meet a certain person.
[cowhand 5] How come you don't wear gloves?
Castrate 1,500 head, then nick your thumb on the last.
translation.ko: 1,500마리를 거세했는데 마지막 한 놈 하다 베였군

translation.en: Well, fatso, I think we're finished.
You're gonna see him creeping all over the place now.
Which also means any Indians camping need to be moved off the property.
-We got animals they want to eat. Got it? -[dog barking]
Keep your eyes and ears open.
Maybe find yourselves an arrowhead up by them aspens.
It's George's week in town, so it's just Phil.
translation.ko: 이번 주는 조지가 마을에 가서 필밖에 없거든

translation.en: Oh no. It's… it's not a snake, is it?
[Peter] Come here. Come here. Come here.
You can eat in your room.
[housekeeper] They dug up that graveyard to make way for the new highway.
Among those buried there was a friend of mine.
A clumsy tractor driver broke open the coffin,
translation.ko: 어설픈 트랙터 운전사 때문에 걔 관 뚜껑이 열렸는데

translation.en: and they found her hair had continued to grow after her death.
translation.ko: 안의 시체를 보니 머리카락이 자란 거 아니겠어요?

translation.en: The whole coffin just stuffed with her lovely golden hair.
translation.ko: 아름다운 금발이 관에 꽉 차 있었죠

translation.en: Except for a few feet from the end,
-[housekeeper] Some say she was a beauty. -What?
[housekeeper] Golden braids on top of her hair.
Oh! Yes, go and see. It's very sweet.
-No, please. Get out of my room. -Where's your rabbit?
Now, even if you're happy being in your room all day,
-Mom, I have a lot to do. -Come on.
But if I want to be a surgeon, I have to practice.
Well, you're not to kill them in the house, Peter.
No, I'm putting my foot down.
Oh, where'd a man be if he always did what his mother told him?
translation.ko: 엄마 말만 듣고 살면 어른이 못 되잖아?

translation.en: I know, Lola. You don't have to…
You don't have to narrate it. I'll just… remember.
translation.ko: 말 안 해줘도 돼요, 알아서 셀게요

translation.en: Lola, can you please take over? I have a migraine.
-[cowhand 1] Where do you want me? -Back there.
-I hit that way. -I was aiming for you.
[Rose sniffles] I feel like my eyes are going to pop out of my head.
He's just a man, Peter, only another man.
Yeah? You want 'em off, do you?
Get out of here, you little bitch! You hear me?
♪ Let the snow melt off Wash away my sorrow ♪
translation.ko: 눈을 녹여서 내 슬픔 씻겨 나가게 해주오

translation.en: [cowhand] ♪ I said, "Oh, Lord, oh, Lord" ♪ ♪ "Oh, Lord, oh, Lord" ♪
♪ I said, "Oh, Daddy, oh, Daddy Oh, Daddy, oh" ♪
♪ I said, "Oh, Daddy, oh, Daddy Oh, Daddy, oh" ♪
No one tell him to soak those jeans?
[Phil] Well, I don't see any Mr. Burbank here.
I guess it's hard for a young'un like you to call an old fella like me
translation.ko: 훨씬 나이 많은 아저씨가 대뜸 이름으로 부르라고 하면 어색하겠지

translation.en: Now come and take a look at this.
Have you done any braiding or plaiting yourself, Pete?
translation.ko: 뭘 땋거나 엮어 본 적 있나?

translation.en: Peter, we kind of got off on the wrong foot.
translation.ko: 피터 우리 첫인상이 별로 안 좋았지

translation.en: People who get to be good friends.
Now, you see? You did it.
I'm gonna finish this rope and give it to you and teach you how to use it.
translation.ko: 밧줄 완성해서 줄게 쓰는 법도 알려주고

translation.en: Sort of a lonesome place out here, Pete.
Unless you get in the swing of things.
How long do you expect it would take to finish that rope?
I could get it finished before you go back to school.
It won't be very long then, Phil.
You can sit on it, Pete.
Don't let your mom make a sissy of you.

translation.ko: 뭐 거기 앉아만 있어도 승마는 다 배운 거나 다름없어

translation.en: you're soaking up all the riding know-how you'll ever need and then some.
translation.ko: 거기 앉아만 있어도 승마는 다 배운 거나 다름없어

translation.en: That saddle belonged to Bronco Henry.
There's a cliff way out back of the ranch with initials and 1805 carved into it.
translation.ko: 목장 뒤쪽 절벽에 이름이랑 1805년이 새겨져 있어

translation.en: Must have been some fella from the Lewis and Clark Expedition.
translation.ko: 루이스와 클라크 원정대 중 한 사람이었겠지

translation.en: They were real men in those days.
Let's say just you and me go out for a couple of days.
Find those trails and follow them to the end.
translation.ko: 그 길을 찾아서 끝까지 가 보는 거야

translation.en: Wouldn't be surprised if there were gold
or precious minerals in them there rocks.
[Peter] Do many of the calves die from wolves?
There's always a few that get… tore up or hamstrung or die of anthrax.
translation.ko: 늘 몇 마리는 죽어 늑대한테 물리거나 힘줄이 끊기거나 탄저병에 걸리지

translation.en: You know, you talk like a Victrola record. You know that?
translation.ko: 너 꼭 녹음한 것처럼 말하는 거 알아?

translation.en: -Did Bronco Henry teach you to ride, Phil? -[Phil] Yep.
He taught me to use my eyes in ways that other people can't.
translation.ko: 다른 사람은 못 보는 걸 보는 법도 알려줬지

translation.en: Most people look at it and just see a hill.
Where Bronco looked at it, what do you suppose he saw?
-The hell, you just saw that now? -No.
See, it looks like a dog with its jaw wide open.
Can't you come in and talk for a little?
You've gotten to be quite friendly with Phil, haven't you?
He's making a rope for me.
Peter, I wish you wouldn't make that sound with your comb.
I felt a chill in my spine when I heard the chalk squeak on a blackboard.
translation.ko: 칠판 긁는 소리를 들으면 등골이 오싹했어

translation.en: Oh, Miss… [chuckling] Mrs. Merchant, that's who it was.
She… she drew chalk stars by our names on the blackboard.
translation.ko: 칠판에 적힌 학생들 이름에 별을 그리곤 하셨지

translation.en: I wonder why it was stars she gave us.
Why not diamonds? Why not hearts?
I wonder why it was always stars.
Because stars are supposed to be unreachable.
But they weren't unreachable because she gave them to us.
We had this valentine box, and it was covered with white crepe paper.
translation.ko: 하얀 주름 종이로 감싼 밸런타인 상자가 있었어

translation.en: And we would paste big, red hearts on it.
And you had a great many valentines.
Is there a sound that makes you shiver?
translation.ko: 너도 들으면 소름 돋는 소리 있어?
우린 닿을 수 없는 존재가 아냐
우린 닿을 수 없는 존재가 아냐

translation.en: Mother, you don't have to do this.
I'll see you don't have to do it.
-[Phil] This his first week? -[cowhand 1] Nope, third.
translation.ko: 저 녀석 첫 주야? - 아뇨, 셋째 주요 - 그래?

translation.en: Open up the gate. Let him out.
-You sure? He's not ready. -Go on. Let him out.
-[Phil] What you doing? -Going to give him a hand.
-Let him figure it out. -[cowhand 4] Oh, oh!
Fall off, you get back on.
[George in distance] Any happenings while I was away?
[George] Where are you two off to?
Can't Peter go with you today?
Well, he could, but him and Phil have kinda paired up.
-I don't want him to be with Phil at all. -But, Rose…
[splutters] He's helping him. He taught him how to ride.
translation.ko: 형이 잘 돌봐줄 거야 승마도 가르쳐 줬어

translation.en: You know who started riding as late as you?
translation.ko: 너만큼 승마를 늦게 시작한 거 알아?

translation.en: Hadn't done any of it till he was about your age now.
translation.ko: 네 나이 될 때까지 말 근처에도 안 갔대

translation.en: Hey, Peter, let's see how long it takes
before Mr. Cottontail makes a run for the open.
Now, as kids, we used to take bets… [grunts]
before the animals ran out and made a run for it.
I guess he has to be gutsy.
Well, put him out of his misery.
You got a tan. That's a cowboy tan you got.
a man was made by patience and the odds against him.
And you had to try and remove them.
Well, you've certainly got obstacles. That's a fact, Pete, me boy.
translation.ko: 확실히 넌 장애물이 있어 꼬맹이 피터

translation.en: I guess you know she's been half-shot all summer.
I guess he hit the bottle pretty hard?
Until right at the very end.
He used to worry I wasn't kind enough.
Things will work out for you yet.
They were standing right in front of the damn things asking,
"Do we have any hides?" Are they leaving?
translation.ko: 있으면 어쩔 건데? 그 사람들 가니?

translation.en: Yes, they've got their horse going.
[Mrs. Lewis panting] I told them the hides are gonna be burned.
Why are the hides going to be burned?
Phil doesn't want anyone else to have 'em.
Waits till there's a big pile and sets fire to the lot.
translation.ko: 왕창 쌓일 때까지 뒀다가 불을 붙여버리죠

translation.en: [chuckles] He'd blow up if they even touched 'em.
It would be my honor if you would take them.
-[cowhand 1] You all right, ma'am? -[cowhand 2] Is she breathing?
Oh, she really put her foot into it this time.
-Or maybe even gave them away. -[Peter] Why? Why?
Why would she do that, Phil? She knew that we needed the hides.
I'd think you'd know from the books your pa left you
translation.ko: 아빠가 남긴 책에 안 쓰여 있던?

translation.en: that your ma's got a… a whatchamacallit.
Alcoholic personality. It comes under the letter A!
translation.ko: 알코올 중독 인성 철자 A로 시작하지!

translation.en: -You're not gonna say anything to her? -[Phil] Say anything?
translation.ko: - 아무 말 안 하실 거예요? - 뭘 말해?

translation.en: But sure as one good hell, brother George is going to.
translation.ko: 내 동생 놈 변명이나 들어 봐야겠군

translation.en: It is high time that that bozo and you got next to a few…
What do you ever call them? Facts!
She stashes alcohol all around the place, even drinking in the stinking alley.
translation.ko: 온 집 안에 술을 숨겨놨어 집 밖 고물 더미에도!

translation.en: Look at your face in the mirror!
Is it that she could like? Or our money? Wake the hell up!
translation.ko: 그게 좋아 결혼했겠냐? 돈이지! 정신 차려!

translation.en: The hides were only going to be burned.
I've got rawhide to finish the rope.
What are you doing with rawhide?
I wanted to be like you.
That's damn kind of you, Pete.
Everything's gonna be plain sailing for you from now on in.
translation.ko: 이제부턴 네 모든 일에 순풍이 불 거다

translation.en: How old were you when you met Bronco Henry?
translation.ko: 브롱코 헨리를 만났을 때 몇 살이었어요?

translation.en: About the age you are now.
We were way off up in the hills shooting elk, and the weather turned mean.
translation.ko: 언덕에서 엘크를 잡는데 날씨가 험해진 거야

translation.en: Bronco kept me alive by… lying body against body in a bedroll.
translation.ko: 브롱코가 날 살려줬지 한 침낭에서 몸을 맞대고

translation.en: Fell off to sleep that way.
-[cowhand 1] Phil left already? -[cowhand 2] No, he's not here.
He say he was settin' out early? [cowhand 2] No.
He's not been down at all.
I'll run you into Herndon to see the doctor.
Rose would like you to join us for Christmas, if you care to.
I'll know in a day or two when the results come back.
translation.ko: 하루 이틀 뒤면 결과가 올 겁니다

translation.en: But he never handled diseased animals. He was particular on that.
translation.ko: 하지만 형은 동물 사체를 절대로 안 만졌는데요

translation.en: my darling from the power of the dog."
